name: Rosedale on Robson

reviews.text: Just finished a 3 night stay in the Rosedale. Its not a huge
reviews.title: Everything you could want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: walk from the skytrain, and within 15 minutes of gastown and coal harbour. Yaletown is minutes walk. My room was big, excellent bed, separate sitting, cooking area. Not state of the art modern but perfectly ok.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: We stayed here four nights on our first visit, then on our second a week later we were upgraded to the 20th floor. Quiet rooms and a very handy hotel, easy walk to many tourist spots. The staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: NICE STAY AT ROSEDALE

reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights at end of July. I had a lovely room on 10th floor overlooking the gardens at the back of property. I have stayed yrs ago and had Library side view.Both times I found it lovely and quiet there which is a plus point these days with other hotels not offering the same peace. I was surprised one reviewer said it was noisy-maybe I was lucky not being fire station side? Had lovely large room-2 in 1 really-1 lounge/kitchen and other a bedroom divided by a door. It seemed well soundproofed to me-such a bonus these days.
reviews.title: DavenportsUK

reviews.text: I would have thought more than 3 lifts would have been designed for such a large building-you had quite a wait each time as they naturally got busy. Several guests commented the cleaning staff could do with a service lift.
reviews.title: Clean tidy but an average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 days prior to our cruise. The hotel was excellent location and close to the library, where there was a bus stop for the Hop on Hop off tours.The bar & restaurant at the Rosedale was excellent ,we dined there for every meal. Excellent meals & very reasonably priced. Within walking distance to the shops on Robson St. Small taxi fare to cruise terminal.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — Large Room & it had a fridge

reviews.text: suite with kitchenette area, clean with everything you could need. we were on the 18th floor and near a vent shaft, this caused a humming noise all night that irritated my partner but not myself. parking available at $11 per night. staff not the friendliest we had encountered but the hotel itself is worth a stay. excellent value food at Rosies rest. attached to hotel.
reviews.title: canadian holiday 2008

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love Vancouver and returned to the Rosedale for the second time. We were welcomed with an upgrade and had surprise views of snow-capped peaks through high-rise blocks. Reception staff were warm and efficient, going out of the way to provide maps and information. Our suite had everything we needed and the complimentary hot drinks, muffins and pastries each morning were a scrummy bonus.
reviews.title: Our second visit to the Rosedale

reviews.text: We stayed five nights and easily filled our days, taking public transport to Grouse Mountain, Granville Island and walking the fabulous Stanley Park. All in all, a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

likes.disliked: — The fact that dogs are allow in the motel

reviews.text: This was the second time we have stayed at the Rosedale, we had a one bedroom suite, with two queen beds and a pull out sofa in the lounge room. We were traveling with our two teenage sons, we found we had plenty of room for the 4 of us.
reviews.title: A nice stay in an older hotel.

reviews.text: My husband, two teenagers, and I stayed at the Rosedale on Robson Suite Hotel for 4 nights in Vancouver after disembarking from our Alaska Inland Passage cruise on Celebrity. We reserved a 2-bedroom family suite. This suite comes with a queen –sized bed in one bedroom and two twin beds in the other. This worked really well for us since we needed separate beds for our teenage son and daughter. The suite also had a small galley kitchen with a 3-burner stove, microwave, small refrigerator, and coffee maker. We always like to have a refrigerator so we can keep cold waters for use in the room and while traveling.
reviews.title: Nice Family Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located to restaurants and tourist attractions. For example, we walked to the Architectural Institute of British Columbia (AIBC) on Cambie Street for the Gastown Architectural Walking Tour. The hotel also offers a complimentary continental breakfast. It’s a decent continental breakfast with the usual items. Although, be aware, that parking and Wi Fi in the room are additional costs.
reviews.title: Great hotel, highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also have to mention the concierge. He was friendly, knowledgeable, and very helpful. It took us longer than expected to disembark from our cruise, so we arrived at the hotel later than anticipated. We reserved our Avis rental car for a morning pick up and our Gastown Architectural Walking Tour started at 10:00. We could not pick up our car and make our tour. So, we asked the concierge if he would call Avis and inform them that we’d be picking up our car at a later time, between 12 – 1 PM. It wasn’t a problem. He made a copy of our reservation sheet and took care of us. We were able to make our Gastown tour and pick up our rental car at a later time. He also helped us with directions to the Bloedel Floral Conservatory in Queen Elizabeth Park.
reviews.title: Mostly positive but a few negatives

reviews.text: Overall, I highly recommend the Rosedale on Robson Suite Hotel for families.
reviews.title: Outdated but great local and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in July. Very central and convenient location yet quiet. Walk to Grandville street, shops, cafe, restaurants, Canada Place, Chinatown and many more.The suite is large, has TV, desk, kitchen, microwave, cook top etc. It is so comfortable that you feel at home and has very good sleep. Also has coin operated laundry and free Wi Fi at the lobby. Highly recommended, definitely will stay here again!
reviews.title: Great location, clean and easy to like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a superior king suite-it was stunning, with a balcony, separate living and bedrooms, small kitchenette. We were in the 20th floor and the views were amazing, laying in bed with the city stretched out in front if us and a large balcony with patio table and four chairs. It was for the first night of our honeymoon and we were so impressed with the staff-friendly, helpful and everything spotlessly clean. I think we must have been given a free upgrade, as I had contacted the hotel prior to our stay, stating we were on honeymoon, flying in from London and would like a room on the highest floor possible. It was the BEST possible start to our three weeks in BC-we both had massive grins on our faces when we stepped into the suite. And the best part of it was we only spent 115 £GBP on the room through otel.com-highly recommended.
reviews.title: Fantastic Value, Amazing Suite

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, we walked everywhere and if we couldn't walk local transport was nearby. The room was large and well equip, a lounge area, very good kitchenette and very comfy beds. The restaurant was good especially for breakfast. The only downside in the evening were all the TV screens, everywhere you looked!
reviews.title: Great location
Great hotel
reviews.text: The location is central,we walked everywhere from the hotel. The studio room is spacious and the kitchenette adequate. The bed is very comfortable . We were on the 14th floor and when we came back for a night,we were given the penthouse suite on the 21st floor . What a lovely room with a balcony. What a delight! The staff are very helpful and efficient. Great hotel. The only thing against it is that you don't get free wifi. Nowadays that should be part of the package.

We stayed in the Rosedale for four nights as a family of four. The suite came as two bedrooms, with one shared bathroom and a kitchenette area with 3 electric rings, an oven/grill, microwave and kettle. This meant that we could self cater, but one drawback was the space in which to eat - only a coffee table was provided so we ended up eating off our knees.
reviews.title: Good bet for central Vancouver

reviews.text: The hotel is just off the centre of the city - a 5 block walk back to the central station. You can get a bus up there if you don't fancy the walk. A 7-11 store is opposite the hotel with other small shops, liquor store close by. The nearest supermarket is an H-Mart which stocks predominantly Asian products, so we mainly self catered in an oriental style, which made a nice holiday change.
reviews.title: Great location and decent quality of room and equipment

reviews.text: I stayed at the Rosedale for 5 nights & had nothing to complain about at all. Good facilities, helpful staff. Location was good as you are on Robson Street, close to Gastown, restaurants & shopping. Will go back one day if I stopover in Vancouver.
reviews.title: Happy to stay here again!

reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights in early July. Great place to stay in Vancouver, very central, good access to shops, supermarket, all sorts of restaurants. The suite was large and comfortable with a living room, desk, coffee table, TV etc. There is a well-equipped kitchen with everything necessary including microwave, cook top, big sink etc. The bedroom has large comfortable bed, a second TV, desk and looking towards the library building . We saw some fireworks celebrating Canada Day on 1 July. We also saw the light show of BC Place reflecting on the glassy building across the road - which was great. The room was quiet and we have very good nights of sleep. Very handy to have coin operated laundry on every second floor. Will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great location, spacious suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay in Vancouver very central, good access + parking (had to pay for parking not happy about that but city cntr.) The suite was large and comfortable with a sitting area coffee table tv etc sofa bed followed throught to a hallway kitchen with everything necessary, bathroom then bedroom with large comfortable bed and pillows 2 walls of window looking out over a small upper garden area towards the interesting architecture of the library building so a good view from this room with pleasant greenery which is nice in the city. The room was quiet and I did wonder about this when found was next to the lift, but the bedroom is away from this.Used the swimming pool and spa every day and it was mostly quiet. Ask for towels at reception, we got caught out as we usually find they are available in the spa area.
reviews.title: Great location Lovely Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pluses - self catering suite room, central.
reviews.title: Good location but a bit tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and comfortable, quiet
reviews.title: Location, location,location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in the rosedale with its spacious suites. The location was good and it was easy to walk to many attractions. The laundery facilities were on every other floor which meant they were easy to use and the buffet breakfast good. The only downside was that when we used the pool the water was quite cool.
reviews.title: great hotel in a good location

reviews.text: Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for one night to attend a Springsteen concert. Booked 3 months ahead, requested an early check in as one person in a wheelchair who needed a rest break before concert. Arrived 30 minutes ahead of check in, room was not ready. No parking for a van-(didn't fit in underground.) Desk clerk was not friendly, told us to speak to valet about parking, valet directed me on map to a parking lot 4 blocks away. 1 hr later, after hoofing it to park a disabled person's wheels, our room was ready. Upon entry, it reeked of cleaner, wonder what it was covering up?
reviews.title: The worst experience I've had in a Vancouver hotel

likes.liked: — location to concert venues and robson street, great food at restaurant & room service
likes.disliked: — comfort of beds, quality of furnishings, attitude of staff, lack of parking

reviews.text: Website shows a spacious layout, WRONG!, actually 1/2 the size, very dated furniture, nothing matched, dark and dingy.
reviews.title: a good choice

reviews.text: At bedtime, the beds were the worst ever slept on- very old mattresses, saggy, no springs, like cardboard covered cement.
reviews.title: This is the worse hotel I've ever had the displeasure to stay in

reviews.text: When attempting to exit hotel lobby for concert, a workman had his ladder set up on the disabled person ramp. When politely asked to move, he was very surly. Nice touch !
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.disliked: — The 2nd bedroom leaves no room for siutcases, the bed is infront of the wardrobe !

reviews.text: why stay in a small motel room when you can get a 1 bedroom suite for the same price? On trendy Robson st, a short walk to anywhere. very clean, spacious and extremely quiet. We were in a room directly opposite the lifts and barely heard a sound. Room is equipped with cooking facilities so we ate in after wandering around the markets and buying fresh local produce! the motel provides muffins and tea/coffee in the morning, but anything more you need to buy - but you dont really need to!
reviews.title: apartment style for motel room price

likes.liked: — the space and freedom it offered

reviews.text: Bed was heaven at the end of a busy day - so comfortable and spacious! We now look for suites instead of motel rooms after being spoilt here!
reviews.title: More than I expected

reviews.text: I was so worried about the rooms after reading some bad reviews, but it just goes to show that some people are picker than I am. We had 2 suites one for us and the other for the other couple we invited to join us. We booked our rooms with RCI not with the hotel. The hotel does not check you in the Aviawest office checks you in - which is adjacent to the hotel. The Aviawest staff are very friendly and helpful. Leonard made some recommendations for dinner and other activities. The rooms were very clean, there are enough towels for 3 days (there is no maid service with RCI) although if you needed more towels just dial zero - the phone rings at the Aviawest office and they will bring towels immediately. The windows are great - they are floor to ceiling. There were some reviews that complained about the size of the kitchen (why on earth do you need a full size kitchen) the galley kitchen is plenty. It had a stove, mirco wave, refrigerator, nice coffee maker, all the utensils you MIGHT need. There are so many fabulous restaurants in Vancouver why would you want to cook anything? Downstairs there is Rosies which offers a good breakfast plus there is a Starbucks on every corner. The Rosedale is a perfect location and everything is in walking distance..Yaletown, Gastown, Granville street and good shopping. We drove to Whistlers - it snowed, it was beautiful. We took the harbour cruise, Capilano suspension bridge and the tree top adventure was the highlight for us. Anyway take a look at the photos I took it they say it all - the rooms and the sights.
reviews.title: A great stay

likes.disliked: — Sharing a bathroom with 3 members of my family

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights before heading up to Whistler. Staff were very helpful and friendly, location was great, room was quite basic but clean, comfortable and catered to our needs. Restaurant was lovely and 'homely'. Would definately stay again.
reviews.title: much better than expected

reviews.text: Stayed at the Rosedale for 3 nights. Our party consisted of 2 adults and 2 children. Was a litlle unsure about staying here after reading a couple of reviews but was pleasantly surpised on arrival. Our one bedroom suite was a good size and wasn't half as old and dull as I had expected. There was a ceiling to floor bedroom window which let in loads of light and the room was very clean.
reviews.title: Comfortable suite, good location

reviews.text: We stayed her for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon in August. I found the hotel a little bit out of it by that I mean it was a good 15-20 mins walk to everything which was hard when it was hot and we had a 7 year old with us. I also found Vancouver at night very frightening with pan handlers everywhere. Fantastic in the day. Stanley park and the Aquarium are definatly worth a visit. We ate in gas town the first night at the old spagetti factory after having a great meal at the one in Banff. Well it was not at all like that, very disapointing. The second night we got a take away from China Town and it was fantastic. We ate it in our room which had a kitchenette and lounge area. The 3rd night we ate in Earls after eating in the one in Whistler. This was good.
reviews.title: little bit out of it
Good Again
reviews.text: The hotel its self is a little dated and the lifts are a nightmare 1 was not working and they seem to stop on every floor. There is a lot of construction in Vancouver and all we could see from our hotel room was cranes. Quite a dark room in the lounge but the bedroom was ok. I would look for a differnent hotel if going back to vancouver.
I can highly recommend grouse mountain and the capalano suspension bridge. Great day out.
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night at the Rosedale while in Vancouver to take in a Canucks game. We had stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago so we knew what to expect and were not dissappointed. Our room was on the 18th floor with a great view of the downtown are. Our room was lots big enough, clean and quiet.The small kitchen area was good for the late night pizza after the game, and the front sitting area buffers any hall noise from the bedroom area. It is an easy 5-10 min walk from GM Place and handy to Robson Street shopping if you are so inclined. Taxi to the bus depot ran us about $7.00 for our departure to Vanc. Island. Our only complaint, albeit minor was the slow elevators in the hotel. For the price, we will definately be back here.
reviews.title: Good location for concert goers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights before going to Victoria and 2 nights on the way back and we were really pleased with our rooms. It was clean, warm. comfy and spacious. We had fantastic views across the city and the staff were really helpful. We were able to leave some of our luggage as we were returning and didn't want to take it all to Victoria on the coach and boat. We also left luggage at the hotel on our last day before returning back to the UK and the staff booked our taxi for us so it gave us the day to see more of Vancouver. Have to say that the hotels website does not do it justice and that we were aprehensive but would definetley book again.
reviews.title: Great Stay

description: In the heart of the entertainment and sports district, the Rosedale on Robson Suite Hotel offers you comfort and relaxation, with water and mountain views, in a perfect central location. We are a very short walking distance to Rogers Arena, BC Place, the Queen Elizabeth Theatre, the Westside Church, and historic Yaletown, Gastown, Chinatown.Discover fabulous shops and cafes along the way. Choose from our array of one and two bedroom suites with 2 doubles, queen-size and/or king-size beds. Every suite offers the comforts of home with fully equipped galley kitchens for people who love to have that convenience. Need to stay connected? You can access WiFi throughout the hotel. Need to relax? Enjoy our indoor lap pool and whirlpool or find a touch of nature in our second floor garden terrace. Fitness on your mind? The poolside lobby fitness area has treadmills and more.
